message.content:
cs.SE, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.PL, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses a technique for improving software maintenance by reformulating queries for concept location. This involves identifying appropriate search terms from source code using a novel term weight, CodeRank, and then suggesting effective reformulation to the initial query by exploiting source document structures, query quality analysis, and machine learning. This work is highly relevant to the software engineering community and falls under the sub-category of cs.SE (Software Engineering). Additionally, the use of CodeRank and machine learning techniques suggests that this paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of programming languages and source code, which may make it relevant to the sub-category of cs.PL (Programming Languages). Finally, the use of document structures and query quality analysis suggests that this paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
